definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Everyone knows he was wrongly accused.
Some time later the Boy was falsely accused of stealing sheep.
sentences.chinese: 過了一些日子，男孩被人誣告偷了羊。

sentences.english: His manager framed a theft against him. saying the undergraduate stole an ultraviolet-proof umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 他的經理誣告說大學生偷了一把防紫外線的雨傘。

sentences.english: She was accused falsely, called back to England, and later vindicated by the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 她曾被人誣告，因而被差會召回英國，後來蒙主表白。

sentences.english: Then she went to the king and accused her of being a cannibal.
sentences.chinese: 然後，她到國王面前去誣告王后，說她是喫人的妖怪。

sentences.english: Having been falsely accused, Paul and Silas found themselves in jail at Philippi.
sentences.chinese: 當時保羅和西拉被誣告而在腓立比坐牢。

sentences.english: His employer laid false charges against him.
sentences.chinese: 他的僱主對他提出誣告。

sentences.english: Several men were falsely accused of having dressed as women in order to save their lives.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些人因此被誣告裝成女人來逃命。

sentences.english: When you are being falsely accused, look up to Him.
sentences.chinese: 當你被誣告的時候，要仰望主。

sentences.english: He came back with a strong protest against their false charge.
sentences.chinese: 他對他們的誣告提出強烈的抗議。

sentences.english: She swore against me, saying I had stolen her purse.
sentences.chinese: 她誣告我是小偷，一口咬定我偷了她的錢包。

sentences.english: Then, she went to the queen before the king to false accusations, saying that she was eating monster.
sentences.chinese: 然後，她到國王面前去誣告王后，說她是喫人的妖怪。
